components.description: The Mail Listener connector provides a listener that listens for changes from a remote IMAP mailbox. Every time a new email is received, a new event is triggered and the flow following this component is executed. For IMAP type mailboxes there are two poll strategies: POLLING and IDLE. The polling strategy periodically checks for new emails on the remote server. The IDLE strategy allows the component to receive in real time new emails events from the remote host, without requiring polling. This capability depends on the server and it is not always supported.

objectProperties.name: protocol
objectProperties.description: Sets the IMAP protocol to be used in the connection. Use IMAP for a normal connection or IMAPs to use it over SSL

objectProperties.name: host
objectProperties.description: The IMAP server host to be used for the connection.

objectProperties.name: port
objectProperties.description: The IMAP server port to be used for the connection.

objectProperties.name: username
objectProperties.description: Username used to connect with the email server.

objectProperties.name: password
objectProperties.description: Password used to connect with the email server.

objectProperties.name: socketTimeout
objectProperties.description: Socket I/O timeout value in milliseconds

objectProperties.name: connectTimeout
objectProperties.description: Socket connection timeout value in milliseconds.

objectProperties.name: startTlsEnabled
objectProperties.description: If true, enables the use of the STARTTLS command (if supported by the server) to switch the connection to a TLS-protected connection before issuing any login commands. If the server does not support STARTTLS, the connection continues without the use of TLS.

objectProperties.name: trustedHosts
objectProperties.description: If set to "*", all hosts are trusted. If set to a whitespace separated list of hosts, those hosts are trusted. Otherwise, trust depends on the certificate the server presents.

properties.name: folder
properties.description: The name of the IMAP folder this listener should be checking email from.

properties.name: peek
properties.description: If true the mail message is not set as 'seen' in the IMAP folder it was pulled from.

properties.name: batch
properties.description: If true and there are multiple emails in the IMAP folder, emails are grouped in a list. The message following the listener is a list containing email data inside a map object.

properties.name: deleteOnSuccess
properties.description: If true deletes permanently a message from the IMAP folder whenever the flow completes successfully. If you only want to mark a message 'deleted' without removing it permanently use the property named 'Mark message/s deleted on success'.

properties.name: strategy
properties.description: The polling strategy used by the listener: it could be POLLING or IDLE. The polling strategy periodically checks for new emails on the remote server. The IDLE strategy allows the component to receive in real time new emails events from the remote host, without requiring polling. This capability depends on the server and it is not always supported.

properties.name: pollInterval
properties.description: Sets the poll interval delay. New messages will be checked every X + 'poll interval' delay time. Can be applied only when strategy is 'POLLING'.

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Limits the number of emails to be processed for each poll. If the number of emails fetched during a poll is greater than the limit, the remaining emails will be processed in the next poll iteration.

properties.name: markDeleteOnSuccess
properties.description: If true marks a message to be 'deleted' without removing it permanently.

properties.name: flags
properties.description: Flags to be used to fetch messages when strategy is 'POLLING'. The flags can be used to fetch seen/deleted or answered messages.

objectProperties.name: seen
objectProperties.description: If true, seen email messages are fetched from the IMAP server.

objectProperties.name: deleted
objectProperties.description: If true, email messages marked as 'deleted' are fetched from the IMAP server.

objectProperties.name: answered
objectProperties.description: If true, answered email messages are fetched from the IMAP server.

components.description: Sends an email using SMTP or SMPTs. Several attachments can be configured to be sent together in the email. Attachments might come from different sources such as filesystem files, project resources or evaluated script expressions.

objectProperties.name: protocol
objectProperties.description: Sets the SMTP protocol to be used in the connection. Use SMTP for a normal connection or SMTPs to use it over SSL

objectProperties.name: host
objectProperties.description: The SMTP server host to be used for the connection.

objectProperties.name: port
objectProperties.description: The SMTP server port to be used for the connection.

objectProperties.name: username
objectProperties.description: Username used to connect with the email server.

objectProperties.name: password
objectProperties.description: Password used to connect with the email server.

objectProperties.name: socketTimeout
objectProperties.description: Socket I/O timeout value in milliseconds

objectProperties.name: connectTimeout
objectProperties.description: Socket connection timeout value in milliseconds.

objectProperties.name: startTlsEnabled
objectProperties.description: If true, enables the use of the STARTTLS command (if supported by the server) to switch the connection to a TLS-protected connection before issuing any login commands. If the server does not support STARTTLS, the connection continues without the use of TLS.

properties.name: from
properties.description: Sets the source address to be used in the email. It can be a static or a dynamic expression.

properties.name: to
properties.description: Sets the destination addresses of the email. It can contain a comma separated list of recipients.

properties.name: subject
properties.description: Sets the subject to be used in the email.

objectProperties.name: charset
objectProperties.description: Sets the charset of the mail body.

objectProperties.name: contentType
objectProperties.description: Sets the content type of the mail body.

objectProperties.name: content
objectProperties.description: The result of the evaluation of this expression is set as mail body content.

properties.name: cc
properties.description: The 'CC' addresses to be used in the email. It can contain a comma separated list of addresses.

properties.name: bcc
properties.description: The 'BCC' addresses to be used in the email. It can contain a comma separated list of addresses.

properties.name: replyTo
properties.description: The 'Reply To' addresses to be used in the email. It can contain a comma separated list of reply to addresses.

properties.name: attachmentsMap
properties.description: Sets the attachments map to be used as a source of the mail attachments. An attachments map can be created using: {'attachment1': MailAttachmentBuilder.create().text('hello world').filename('my-text.txt').build() }

objectProperties.name: name
objectProperties.description: A display name of the attachment used in the Flow Designer and as email attachment description.

objectProperties.name: contentType
objectProperties.description: Sets the mime type of the attachment to be sent in the email.

objectProperties.name: charset
objectProperties.description: Sets the charset of the attachment.

objectProperties.name: sourceType
objectProperties.description: Determines the source of the attachment. If 'RESOURCE', the attachment content is read from a file from the project's resources folder, if 'FILE', the content is read from a file on the filesystem, if 'EXPRESSION', the result of the evaluated script expression is used as attachment content.

objectProperties.name: resourceFile
objectProperties.description: The path and name of the attachment file to be read from the project's resources folder.

objectProperties.name: file
objectProperties.description: The path and name of the file to be read from the filesystem.

objectProperties.name: expression
objectProperties.description: The expression to be evaluated as attachment content.

objectProperties.name: fileName
objectProperties.description: The file name of the attachment to be used is used. A static or dynamic expression can be used in this property.If attachment source is 'Resource' and this field is empty, the resource file name will be used instead. If attachment source is 'File' and this field is empty, the file name will be used instead. If attachment source is 'Expression' and this field is empty, an exception will be thrown.
